all_findings.title: Memory operation in assembly
all_findings.description: Memory operation at line 61 can corrupt Solidity memory

evidence.recommendation: Ensure memory operations don't overlap with Solidity

all_findings.title: Potential Front-Running Vulnerability
all_findings.description: Line 54: Function may be vulnerable to front-running. Consider adding deadline and slippage protection.

all_findings.title: Potential Integer Overflow in Unchecked Block
all_findings.description: Line 45: Arithmetic operation in unchecked block may overflow. Ensure this is intentional and safe.

all_findings.title: Rounding direction not specified
all_findings.description: Division at line 4 may have exploitable rounding

evidence.recommendation: Explicitly specify rounding direction (favor protocol or user)

evidence.recommendation: Add detailed comments explaining assembly operations

all_findings.title: State variable could potentially be immutable
all_findings.description: State variable at line 55 might be immutable if only set in constructor

evidence.recommendation: If this variable is only set once in the constructor, declare it as immutable to save gas

all_findings.title: Negative numbers cost more gas
all_findings.description: Negative number at line 1 costs extra gas

evidence.recommendation: Use subtraction or unsigned types when possible

all_findings.title: Consider using != instead of >
all_findings.description: Greater-than at line 30 costs more than not-equal

evidence.recommendation: If checking for zero, use != 0 instead of > 0
